alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 2:43PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOWFALL FOR THE PANHANDLES... A low pressure system centered over New Mexico will bring snowfall chances to the Panhandles starting late this evening and continuing into tomorrow morning. The precipitation should start in the northern OK Panhandle this evening before moving south-southeast into the remainder of the combined Panhandles tonight into the early morning hours tomorrow. Snowfall will then dissipate over portions of the central Texas Panhandle mid to late morning as remnant snow showers. Snowfall amounts will range from a Trace in the eastern Panhandles to around one inch with locally higher amounts from Vega to Dumas to Guymon and points north and west. Best chances for any snowfall accumulations will be in the far northwestern Panhandles near the New Mexico and Colorado state lines. Wind chill values will be in the single digits to around zero degrees by tomorrow morning. Cold conditions along with snowfall may bring some impacts to the Thursday morning commute. High temperatures tomorrow are expected to not get above freezing for the majority of the combined Panhandles. Stay tuned to the developments of this winter system by visiting our homepage at www.weather.gov/ama/. Or on Facebook or Twitter.
